Package com.intellij.openapi.externalSystem.service.settings

Class AbstractImportFromExternalSystemControl<ProjectSettings extends ExternalProjectSettings,L extends ExternalSystemSettingsListener<ProjectSettings>,SystemSettings extends AbstractExternalSystemSettings<SystemSettings,ProjectSettings,L>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.externalSystem.service.settings.AbstractSettingsControl
      • com.intellij.openapi.externalSystem.service.settings.AbstractImportFromExternalSystemControl<ProjectSettings,L,SystemSettings>

  • public abstract class AbstractImportFromExternalSystemControl<ProjectSettings extends ExternalProjectSettings,L extends ExternalSystemSettingsListener<ProjectSettings>,SystemSettings extends AbstractExternalSystemSettings<SystemSettings,ProjectSettings,L>>
extends AbstractSettingsControl
    A control which knows how to manage settings of external project being imported.

    • Method Detail

      • setCurrentProject

        public void setCurrentProject(Project currentProject)
        This control is assumed to be used at least at two circumstances: 
         
          
   
        • new ide project is being created on the external project basis;
          • 
   
        • new ide module(s) is being added to the existing ide project on the external project basis;
          •
        We need to differentiate these situations, for example, we don't want to allow linking an external project to existing ide project if it's already linked.

        This property helps us to achieve that - when an ide project is defined, that means that new modules are being imported to that ide project from external project; when this property is null that means that new ide project is being created on the target external project basis.

        Parameters:
        currentProject - current ide project (if any)

      • onLinkedProjectPathChange

      • createSystemSettingsControl

        protected abstract ExternalSystemSettingsControl<SystemSettings> createSystemSettingsControl(SystemSettings settings)
        Creates a control for managing given system-level settings (if any).
        Parameters:
        settings - target system settings
        Returns:
        a control for managing given system-level settings; null if current external system doesn't have system-level settings (only project-level settings)
